alert.note: Alert for Western Twin Falls BLM (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 26 at 8:55PM MDT until July 27 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES WILL CREATE CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS THROUGH EARLY THIS EVENING AND AGAIN ON THURSDAY... .Gusty southwest winds with very low relative humidity will continue through early this evening across Southwest Idaho, especially near the Nevada border, before subsiding overnight. West to southwest winds will become gusty once again Thursday afternoon and early evening with very low relative humidity. The dry and windy combination will result in critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 9 PM MDT THURSDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES FOR WESTERN TWIN FALLS BLM...WHICH IS FIRE WEATHER ZONE 424... * WINDS...West 15 to 20 mph with gusts to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will occur shortly.
